title: Biden Admin Authorizes Chevron to Resume Oil Pumping in Venezuela
description: The Chevron logo is displayed at a Chevron gas station located in Alameda, Calif., in this file photo. (Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)

title: Mbappe Scores 2, France Reaches Knockout Stage of World Cup
description: France's Kylian Mbappe celebrates after scoring his sides second goal during the World Cup group D soccer match between France and Denmark, at the Stadium 974 in Doha, Qatar, on Nov. 26, 2022. (Thanassis Stavrakis/AP Photo)

title: Ghana Plans to Buy Oil With Gold Instead of US Dollars
description: Ghana's Vice-President Mahamudu Bawumia is sworn in at the Independence square in Accra, Ghana, on Jan. 7, 2017. (Luc Gnago/Reuters)

title: Suspect in Australia Murder Arrested in India 4 Years Later
description: Delhi Police Special Cell officers escort Rajwinder Singh (2R) to Patiala court after being arrested in relation to the 2018 murder of Australian national Toyah Cordingley in Australia's Queensland state, in New Delhi, on Nov. 25, 2022. (AFP via Getty Images)

title: Don’t Have a Cow: Senator’s Legen-Dairy Speech Draws Metaphor From Bovine Caper
description: Cows on a dairy farm, in Saint-Henri-de-Taillon, Que., Sept. 25, 2018. (The Canadian Press/Jacques Boissinot)

title: Small Business Confidence in Canada Hits One of Lowest Levels Ever, CFIB Says
description: A worker boards up a closed clothing store in Vancouver on April 16, 2020. (Darryl Dyck/The Canadian Press)

title: Taiwan President Quits as Party Head After China Threat Bet Fails to Win Votes
description: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen announces her resignation as Democratic Progressive Party chair to take responsibility for the party's performance in the local elections in Taipei, Taiwan, on Nov. 26, 2022. (Ann Wang/Reuters)

title: Report Says London Fire Brigade ‘Institutionally Misogynist and Racist’ but Not Impacting Operations
description: London Fire Brigade logo from the side of a fire engine at a fire station in East London, on July 21, 2022. (Aaron Chown/PA Media)

title: The Public Consequences of Falling Marriage Rates
description: Numerous studies have found a correlation between stable, married-parent families and their kids’ education levels, as well as less trouble with the law or teen pregnancy. (Monkey Business Images/Shutterstock)

title: Lewandowski Scores at World Cup, Poland Beats Saudis 2–0

title: Ontario Tribunal Decision Could Define Limit on Doctors’ Freedoms Nationwide

title: Taiwan Voters Cast Ballots in Local Elections Framed as Battle Against China

title: Huge Protests Erupt in China’s Xinjiang Over Strict Zero-COVID Curbs
description: Protests against strict COVID-19 curbs in Urumqi city, Xinjiang, China, in this screen grab obtained from a video released on Nov. 25, 2022. (Video obtained by Reuters/via Reuters)

title: Reports: At Least 8 Dead in Landslide on Italian Island
description: Destroyed cars are pictured in Casamicciola in the southern Ischia island following heavy rains that sparked a landslide, in Italy, on Nov. 26, 2022.  (ANSA/Ansa/AFP via Getty Images)

title: Australia Beats Tunisia 1–0 to Revive Its World Cup Campaign
